required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Spinal Anesthesia and Peri-operative Opioid Consumption in Open Abdominal Prostatectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Spinal Anesthesia on Peri-operative Opioid Consumption in Open Abdominal Prostatectomy- a Retrospective Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: Retrospective analysis to assess the impact of spinal anesthesia on peri-operative opioid consumption during open abdominal prostatectomy. The authors compare the group that had spinal anesthesia in combination with propofol sedation and a laryngeal mask to the second group that underwent the same procedure in general anesthesia with tracheal intubation.

detailed_description.textblock:
Retrospective analysis to assess the impact of spinal anesthesia on peri-operative opioid consumption during open abdominal prostatectomy. The authors compare the group that had spinal anesthesia in combination with propofol sedation and a laryngeal mask to the second group that underwent the same procedure in general anesthesia with tracheal intubation.
...

secondary_outcome.description: Consumption of sufentanil [mg] during surgery. Piritramid is given if NRS score is > 3.
Postoperative pain level measured with the highest score in numeric pain rating scale (NRS)
Time interval between postoperative tracheal extubation and the patient reaching fit-for-discharge criteria from the PACU to the ward.
Occurence of post-operative nausea and vomiting or shivering in PACU.

arm_group.description: Patients receive spinal anesthesia for analgesia to undergo open abdominal prostatectomy. Ventilation is secured via a laryngeal mask under propofol sedation and no muscular blocking is necessary.

General anesthesia is conducted with a combination of intravenous opioid (sufentanil) and neuromuscular blocking agent for open abdominal prostatectomy. Patients receive an induction bolus of propofol, undergo tracheal intubation and maintenance of sedation by sevoflurane.

intervention.description: Patients undergo standardized open abdominal prostatectomy.

study_pop.textblock: We aim to include patients that are scheduled for elective, radical open abdominal prostatectomy. Thus only male patients of 18 years or older will participate. Patients with chronic pain therapy (e.g. out-of-hospital opioid therapy) will be excluded from the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- elective, radical abdominal prostatectomy
- >18 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- chronic pain therapy (e.g. out-of-hospital opioid therapy)
- laparoscopic approach

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology; Center of Anesthesiology and Intensive Care Medicine, Hamburg Eppendorf University Medical Center
